text:
oh thank you thank you for that lovely
round of applause isn't it nice to

receive a warm welcome a polite greeting
offered to someone as they appear is a

warm welcome you are pleased to see
someone so you offer them a warm welcome

an audience might clap or applaud the
action of a group of people clapping is

a round of applause
you can also applaud someone for their

achievements you give praise and
encouragement to someone by telling them

how happy you are for them you applaud
them I know what you're thinking now mr.

Duncan when are you going to start
today's full English lesson that is a

very good question so without any more
delay let's get on with today's full
English lesson right
now

here is an interesting word that you
might hear being used from time to time

the word is cliche it sounds French
that's because it is French however we

often use this word in English as well
the word cliche is a noun that means a

phrase or opinion that is overused and
unoriginal.

to show a lack of imagination by coming out with an
overused thought or opinion can be
described as using a cliche
a cliched thing is something that is

unoriginal and predictable you know what
is going to happen before it occurs a

worn-out notion is a cliche a story
might have a cliche at the end the

conclusion of a story is obvious and not
unexpected

a predictable and unoriginal thing is a
cliche some people see life is a cliche

they know how it started and they are
pretty sure how it will end the word

itself derived from the French word for
stereotype a familiar thing that holds

no surprise is a cliche it has been done
before so many times it is...
it is a cliche

how are things going with your English
studies are you progressing well are you

happy with the way it is going or are
there some annoying difficulties you are

experiencing right now one of the
biggest problems with learning a new

language is appreciating how well you
are doing it is very easy to

underestimate how well you are
progressing with your English learning

you might think you are doing much worse
than you actually are this is one of the

reasons why you might need to build some
self-confidence in not only your ability

to learn but also to appreciate how far
you have come with your studies during

my time I have mentored many students
who have an unrealistic view of how much

they have learned try to avoid always
comparing yourself to other English

speakers as I said in the previous
lesson you must not put too much

pressure on yourself learn to appreciate
how much you have learned be proud of

what you have achieved so far learning
is a journey and on that journey it is

useful to take a look back now and again
to fully appreciate how far you have
come with your English Studies

it's time to take a look at another
buzzword a buzzword is a word or

phrase that is popular during a certain
time or is generally used today's

buzzword is privilege the word privilege
is generally used as a noun and means a

special right advantage or immunity
granted or available only to a

particular person or group in this sense
the word is used to show inequality or a

certain and bias towards a particular
social group some people see privilege

as a thing enjoyed only by a certain
race or someone with a high social

standing it always seems to be the
privileged few who get into a good

university the privilege might be there
from birth examples of which include

being born in a particular country to a
certain social class or of a certain

race the topic of privilege has become a
hot subject over the years the

perception that one social group has
more rights than another often relates

to the notion of privilege we can also
use privilege to express the honour of

doing something it is a privilege for me
to be here with you all again another

use of privilege relates to the right of
a lawyer or official to refuse to

divulge or reveal confidential
informations the private or confidential

conversations between a professional and
their client can be classed as

privileged information
it cannot be disclosed the phrase check

your privilege is used to suggest that
someone should recognise that their

attitudes or views reflect the fact that
they are in a privileged or advantageous

position because of their particular
social category or categories to which

they belong
for example there is the concept of

'white privilege' which suggests an
inherent bias or favouritism towards

those who are Caucasian the original
meaning of the word privilege literally

means private law and comes from Latin
with the original definition expressing
a particular law affecting an individual

do you know someone who is pretentious
have you ever met someone who tries hard

to appear sophisticated and superior if
so then you have met a pretentious

person to be pretentious means to appear
superior by affecting an air of

sophistication and intellectual prowess
a pretentious person will go out of

their way to appear better than others
by displaying a certain style or

behaving in a particular way they are
putting on a fake front so as to appear

better than other people their pretense
is literally a sham it is not real they

are affecting a certain manner with the
hope of impressing others around them to

affect is to put on something that is
not really you

you are acting in a certain way did you
see the way she was dressed in that

kimono with those chopsticks in her hair
how pretentious a pretentious person

will often be picked out by others
however they will rarely be told to

their face just how pretentious they
appear it takes a lot of courage to tell

someone that they are pretentious he
always likes to use big words to look

clever one day I'll tell him how
pretentious he really looks the action

of showing pretense is pretension a
person might express emotions that they

do not really feel they might say things
that they don't really believe they

express opinions just to appear educated
and enlightened a thing can be described

as pretentious if it is trying to gain
attention by appearing more important

than it really is
it is trying to gain a greater merit

than it actually deserves I couldn't sit
through the whole movie I found its

editing in dialogue really pretentious
the word pretense derives from the Latin

for so called
or alleged to show pretentiousness is to

display ostentation artificiality
posturing and snobbery that person is
being pretentious

they say that parting is such sweet
sorrow yes we have come to the end of
